snippet: Iran’s oil exports declined in April for the second consecutive month, the International Energy Agency reported Thursday, moving much closer to levels permitted under a temporary accord on the Iranian nuclear dispute that is set to expire in July.
abstract: International Energy Agency reports that Iran’s oil exports have declined in April for the second consecutive month, moving much closer to levels permitted under a temporary accord on the Iranian nuclear dispute that is set to expire in July.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s oil exports declined in April for the second consecutive month, the International Energy Agency reported Thursday, moving much closer to levels permitted under a temporary accord on the Iranian nuclear dispute that is set to expire in July.

headline.main: Iran: Oil Exports Continue to Decline
headline.print_headline: Iran: Oil Exports Continue to Decline
